data.message: Can sulfites affect your sleep? Make you sleepy or keep you up?
Sulphites definitely keep me wide awake all night
Oh my goodness yes. If I ingest sulfites I feel exhausted and fatigued but will get bouts of insomnia. Sometimes my brain will go on hyperdrive preventing me from sleeping. It's nuts.
Brainfog, tiredness and insomnia too
Well it’s good to know what’s causing it. Can a sulfite allergy become worse?
Yes
Mike Balasa, I think that is what’s happening. The reactions are becoming more intense. Are there allergy shots for sulfites?
You need to be aware of your other allergies as well, it could be something else.
Mike Balasa, I have a lot of allergies, too.
Yes. At times extremely sleep, especially if I attempt any type of concentration and at times physically exhausted but my brain is hyperactive and I will be awake all night.
That's what I'm experiencing.  I cannot seem to shut my brain down.  Very hard to focus at work, too.  Struggle to concentrate.
Yes, sometimes I lay awake all night even when I’m quite tired. It’s been my pattern for the brain to go into overdrive at bedtime.

Yes just ask my breastfed baby who is highly sensitive to sulphites. He sleeps 8 hours through the night unless I've accidentally had sulphites and then he is awake allll night for 3+ days. And he's just getting the sulphites through my breastmilk! 
Depending on the quantity consumed, sulphites give my husband fatigue + insomnia too.
I would get allergy testing to see if something else is also affecting you.
Can sulfites cause brain fog?  I'm struggling with major brain fog.  I don't know the cause.
You can do a search on all of these terms for posts on these symptoms, just to let you know. It may be a quicker way to get confirmation than separate posts.
This was one of my major symptoms. Using methylated B12 helped a lot with this after going sulfite free.
Sulfites are neurotoxins so yes...
Sulfites turn into sulfuric acid when they mix with water if not converted into sulfates. Sulfuric acid destroys dopamine which would explain brain fog.
Suzi Jones, interesting.

Linnea Fraser Wieland I think I got the info from EPA. acid rain is sulfuric acid. When it's humid and I'm around auto exhaust, my brain fog gets worse. I also researched sulfur dioxide poisoning which is basically what happens to us when exposed, so the info might have come from OCEA. Emergency treatment is bicarbonate of soda, aka baking soda. In a hospital emergency treatment facility, intravenous bicarbonate of soda is used.

So I use a tbsp of baking soda in water followed with extra water when I'm feeling sulfites symptoms. It helps my gut. My digestive system gets non-functional when I'm exposed to sulfites I think from swelling from sulfuric acid. Fresh celery helps too. Hope you feel better soon!

Also I think social media causes brain fog for anyone. :) I'm limiting my exposure to it in hopes it relieves at my current brain fog. Just has a little baking soda water too. Mine has been so severe that I got in financial trouble from not being able to take care of important business. It's a serious problem!
Yep. My daughter has celiacs and gluten causes brain fog for her too. I think it's part of any reaction to something the body doesn't want
Anyone wind up with heart problems due to the palpitations caused by sulfites?

I’m pretty sure it made my heart murmur worse. It took me 19 months to figure out my problem after I was given antibiotics in an IV. So for 18 months my heart pounded and I had anxiety attacks. Now I can hear my heart murmur when my ear is against a pillow.
Jim Williams, sulfites causes anxiety attacks?

Linnea Fraser Wieland Yes. That was my main symptom. I thought I was having a heart attack one time after eating brownies. If I just eat a little I may not even notice an affect until I lay down and my heart is beating too hard.
Jim Williams, well that explains the anxiety then!
Linnea Fraser Wieland My doctor put me on anxiety pills but I knew it was food because it would start right after I eat.

Towards the end of 2018, I was diagnosed with a heart murmur by the immunologist, which I think has occurred due to my sulfite allergies.  Earlier that year, I was getting really sick so kept a food diary.  I found that prawns and seafood are preserved with Sodium Metabisulfite (E223).  I reacted to a Dominos pizza so I checked with the company.  They said the pizza base had flour treatment agents (516, 300, 920).  I found 516 is Calcium Sulphate.
Interesting.  I eat Dominos occasionally but don't usually react.
yes , meeeee early morning palpitations if i consumed sulphite at night
I'm fascinated by this sulfite/palpitation connection.
I think it has something to do with the body going into fight or flight mode when you put something in it that it sees as an invader. It releases histamine and adrenaline to help you survive.
So it's histamine and adrenaline that cause the palpitations?
Linnea Fraser Wieland I believe so. I’m not sure of all the science behind it. I have also had palps from seasonal allergies and even if I walk into a room full of kittens.
Interesting.

My heart rate increases if I accidentally ingest sulfites being in the E220-228 range.  My diastolic also raises 10 points - normally my blood pressure is 120/80.  When I am reacting, it raises to 120/90.
Carol Miller, that’s fascinating.  My bp has been high. 140-150. Never thought the sulfites could be causing that.  What is the range you refer to for sulfites?

Linnea Fraser Wieland
220	Sulphur dioxide
221	Sodium sulfite
222	Sodium bisulfite
223	Sodium metabisulfite
224	Potassium metabisulfite
226	Calcium sulphite
227	Calcium bisulfite
228	Potassium bisulfite
Carol Miller, thanks. How do you know which range the sulfite you ingested is in?
I assume the higher the number the stronger the sulfite?
Linnea Fraser Wieland I have heard that the higher the number, the worse the additive is.

I need to avoid these preservatives:
   Sorbates                    	200-203
   Benzoates                  	210-219
   Sulphites                  	220-228
   Nitrates, nitrites          	249-252
   Propionates               	280-283
How do you know this?  Just trial and error.  Or did an allergist provide the info?
Linnea Fraser Wieland I have symptoms when I ingest any of these preservatives so anywhere I see them on ingredient lists, I don't purchase the product.
